comments:
From a quick glance at the code, this seems to be a problem with features that 
don't have a provider-name attribute (which should be ok, since that attribute 
is optional). Adding a provider-name in both feature.xml helps. (Btw: the traces below are with an integration build,but I also checked with 3.2 RC7 SDK.)

Steps to reproduce:

The attached site contains two features, of which one has an externalized 
description and a feature.properties file. Both features were created by just
clicking through the new feature wizard. Now I put it into a folder that 
contains also the Eclipse SDK and:

[snip]
leif@seneca ~/temp/testdigest $ tar xfz eclipse-SDK-I20060620-1010-linux-gtk.tar.gz
leif@seneca ~/temp/testdigest $ tar xfz s.tar.gz
leif@seneca ~/temp/testdigest $ java -jar eclipse/startup.jar -data ./workspace -application org.eclipse.update.core.siteOptimizer -digestBuilder -digestOutputDir=. -siteXML=s/site.xml s
Extracting locales from s/features/f1_1.0.0.jar
Extracting locales from s/features/f2_1.0.0.jar
Processing... s/features/f1_1.0.0.jar
leif@seneca ~/temp/testdigest $ cat ./workspace/.metadata/.log
